definition: to spring free from or as if from the ground : jump
examples: a fish leaps out of the water

definition: to pass abruptly from one state or topic to another
examples: the difficult leap from college to the workplace

definition: an act of leaping : spring, bound
a place leaped over or from, the distance covered by a leap
a choice made in an area of ultimate concern

examples: a town growing by leaps and bounds
